revised_title: On the Derivatives of Propane: Chlorination and Substitution Products
tldr: The author investigates the derivatives of propane, specifically the products of its reaction with chlorine. They discover that the main product is propylene dichloride, with smaller amounts of normal propyl chloride and other compounds. The study also highlights the formation of trichlorhydrine and hexachlorpropane, providing insights into the limits of direct substitution in propane and other hydrocarbons.
